security_audit.summary: This skill is pure documentation with no executable code. It defines a protocol for reading local project documents (BRAINSTORM.md, TASKS.md, ERROR_LOG.md) at specific workflow checkpoints. No network calls, no file writing, no command execution, no environment variable access. This is a prompt-based guidance skill with zero attack surface.

content.value_statement: When working on long tasks with many tool calls, AI assistants often forget the original goal as it gets pushed out of the context window. This skill provides a protocol that forces reading of core documents at critical moments to keep the project goal front and center.
actual_capabilities: Defines 4 attention refresh protocols triggered at key workflow moments
Forces reading of BRAINSTORM.md at flow entry to align with original intent
Ensures TASKS.md is read before each task to clarify DoD and requirements
Integrates with flow-dev and flow-ralph for autonomous iteration loops
limitations: This is a protocol definition, not an executable tool - it must be referenced by other skills
Only defines when to read files, does not execute any actions itself
Requires other flow-* commands to trigger the refresh protocols

use_cases.title: Maintain focus on feature goals
use_cases.description: When building complex features across many iterations, stay aligned with the original feature goal and acceptance criteria.

use_cases.title: Prevent context drift
use_cases.description: Teams using Claude Code or similar AI assistants can prevent the AI from drifting away from the original requirements.

use_cases.title: Ensure test-driven development
use_cases.description: QA teams can enforce that each task starts by re-reading the test definition before implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Flow Entry Refresh
prompt_templates.prompt: Before we begin, read BRAINSTORM.md to confirm our success criteria, then read TASKS.md to understand the current phase objectives. What are we trying to achieve?

prompt_templates.title: Task Start Refresh
prompt_templates.prompt: Read TASKS.md for the current task T### paragraph. What are the DoD requirements? What files do we need to touch?

prompt_templates.title: Ralph Iteration Refresh
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new iteration in the Ralph loop
prompt_templates.prompt: Read TASKS.md to find the first incomplete task. Read ERROR_LOG.md to see any recent errors. What should we do next and what should we avoid?

prompt_templates.title: Error Recovery Refresh
prompt_templates.scenario: Recovering from a test or build failure
prompt_templates.prompt: Record the error to ERROR_LOG.md, then read it along with the current TASKS.md task definition. What is the root cause and what is our fix strategy?

output_examples.input: I need to implement the user authentication feature
output: Reading BRAINSTORM.md: Success criteria = JWT-based auth with refresh tokens, secure password hashing
Reading TASKS.md: Current phase = T003 User Login API, DoD = returns JWT token, handles invalid credentials
Focus: Build login endpoint that validates credentials and returns tokens

best_practices: Run Protocol 1 (flow entry) at the start of every development session to realign with project goals
Before implementing any task, always execute Protocol 2 to read the exact DoD requirements
Use Protocol 3 in Ralph iterations to learn from previous errors and avoid repeating mistakes
anti_patterns: Skipping document reads because you 'remember the goal' - context drift is real
Starting tasks without reading the DoD - leads to rework when requirements are misunderstood
Ignoring ERROR_LOG.md during recovery - causes repeated mistakes and wasted time

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for Claude Code CLI and any Claude Code-compatible environment. The protocol can be applied to Claude and Codex with minor adjustments.

faq.question: How many files can this skill read?
faq.answer: The skill reads local project documentation files. There is no practical limit - it can read any number of files as needed by the protocol.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with other flow-* commands?
faq.answer: Yes. It integrates with flow-dev, flow-ralph, and all flow-* commands. The protocols are referenced in their respective command definitions.

faq.question: Is user data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads local project documentation files. No data leaves the local development environment.

faq.question: What if ERROR_LOG.md does not exist?
faq.answer: The protocols handle missing files gracefully. For Protocol 3, simply skip reading ERROR_LOG.md if it does not exist.

faq.question: How is this different from simple reminder prompts?
faq.answer: This is a formal protocol with defined trigger points and actions. It prevents the 'I remember' illusion that leads to context drift in long-running AI-assisted sessions.
